match.title: 1st ODI
match.statusText: South Africa won by 8 wickets (with 53 balls remaining)

image.caption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium
image.longCaption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium, Mirpur, October 15, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 15.00 start, First Session 15.00-18.30 Interval 18.30-19.15, Second Session 19.15-22.45

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan lbw b Imran Tahir 48 (51b 5x4 0x6 93m) SR: 94.11

dismissalComment.html: loud appeal for lbw, finger goes up and the batsman reviews it! the ball turned in from length, Shakib leaned forward to defend and was hit in front of middle and leg after the ball pitched on middle, HawkEye says umpire's call and the decision stays. Big wicket as Shakib goes

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain b Morris 31 (44b 3x4 1x6 59m) SR: 70.45

dismissalComment.html: it's over now, Morris gets his second and Nasir is bowled! He shuffled across completely, went down on a knee to scoop it over short fine leg but missed completely and Morris did not

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: 138kph bowled'im, first ODI wicket for Rabada! Tamim played the wrong line there as Rabada pitched it up on middle and off, Tamim maybe thought it would hold its line but it went on to hit off.

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: two in two for Rabada, not much of a celebration though, just a wide grin on his face! He angled it into the pads, Litton flicked it away but straight to Behardien at midwicket for an easy catch

he's done it, he's getting mobbed by his team-mates for that hat-trick and there's absolute silence at the ground! Quick ball into the pads again, not as full as the one that got Litton, this one on good length and the batsman is beaten on the back foot in an attempt to work it to leg. Misses, hit on the pads, finger goes up!

another one for Rabada, probably the biggest one so far after Sarkar was counterattacking! It looked like and innocuous delivery outside off on length, and Sarkar simply chipped it to Duminy at cover, without any footwork. Low catch taken nicely
five-for on debut! Rabada bowls a slower short ball down the leg side, Mortaza looks to work that away behind square, can only help it along to the keeper, de Kock moves to his left and snaps that up

in the block hole, and bowled! Number six for Rabada as he pitched that one on middle, rolled his fingers over it and it went through to hit the leg stump. Jubair had no clue what was happening in this over

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the angle does it, Sabbir is bowled! Morris brought the ball in from wide of the crease, it angled in sharply and went through the gate to rattle middle and leg. Six down
it's over now, Morris gets his second and Nasir is bowled! He shuffled across completely, went down on a knee to scoop it over short fine leg but missed completely and Morris did not

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal b Rabada 0 (13b 0x4 0x6 17m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: 138kph bowled'im, first ODI wicket for Rabada! Tamim played the wrong line there as Rabada pitched it up on middle and off, Tamim maybe thought it would hold its line but it went on to hit off.

headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Behardien b Rabada 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: two in two for Rabada, not much of a celebration though, just a wide grin on his face! He angled it into the pads, Litton flicked it away but straight to Behardien at midwicket for an easy catch

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah lbw b Rabada 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: he's done it, he's getting mobbed by his team-mates for that hat-trick and there's absolute silence at the ground! Quick ball into the pads again, not as full as the one that got Litton, this one on good length and the batsman is beaten on the back foot in an attempt to work it to leg. Misses, hit on the pads, finger goes up!

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c Duminy b Rabada 27 (27b 4x4 0x6 37m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: another one for Rabada, probably the biggest one so far after Sarkar was counterattacking! It looked like and innocuous delivery outside off on length, and Sarkar simply chipped it to Duminy at cover, without any footwork. Low catch taken nicely

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Imran Tahir b Duminy 24 (38b 1x4 0x6 47m) SR: 63.15

dismissalComment.html: the partnership is broken, very good catch by Tahir! Mushy slog-swept the full delivery from middle stump to the leg side, Tahir ran in from long on and took a sharp catch while diving forward

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman b Morris 5 (13b 0x4 0x6 17m) SR: 38.46

dismissalComment.html: the angle does it, Sabbir is bowled! Morris brought the ball in from wide of the crease, it angled in sharply and went through the gate to rattle middle and leg. Six down

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan lbw b Imran Tahir 48 (51b 5x4 0x6 93m) SR: 94.11

dismissalComment.html: loud appeal for lbw, finger goes up and the batsman reviews it! the ball turned in from length, Shakib leaned forward to defend and was hit in front of middle and leg after the ball pitched on middle, HawkEye says umpire's call and the decision stays. Big wicket as Shakib goes

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c †de Kock b Rabada 4 (12b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: five-for on debut! Rabada bowls a slower short ball down the leg side, Mortaza looks to work that away behind square, can only help it along to the keeper, de Kock moves to his left and snaps that up

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jubair Hossain b Rabada 5 (9b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 55.55

dismissalComment.html: in the block hole, and bowled! Number six for Rabada as he pitched that one on middle, rolled his fingers over it and it went through to hit the leg stump. Jubair had no clue what was happening in this over

headshotImage.caption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain b Morris 31 (44b 3x4 1x6 59m) SR: 70.45

dismissalComment.html: it's over now, Morris gets his second and Nasir is bowled! He shuffled across completely, went down on a knee to scoop it over short fine leg but missed completely and Morris did not

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis not out 63 (75b 7x4 0x6 116m) SR: 84
Rilee Rossouw not out 45 (53b 5x4 1x6 80m) SR: 84.9

dismissalComment.html: QDK has given a catch to cover! It was pitched up outside off, QDK saw room and drove it in the air, but straight to Sabbir Rahman. Sharp catch as the ball was travelling fast
the captain gets his counterpart! Amla shuffled across towards off and exposed his stumps, clipped the ball late from off but straight to short fine leg

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 14 (18b 2x4 0x6 23m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: the captain gets his counterpart! Amla shuffled across towards off and exposed his stumps, clipped the ball late from off but straight to short fine leg

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Nasir Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Sabbir Rahman b Nasir Hossain 35 (41b 5x4 0x6 59m) SR: 85.36

dismissalComment.html: QDK has given a catch to cover! It was pitched up outside off, QDK saw room and drove it in the air, but straight to Sabbir Rahman. Sharp catch as the ball was travelling fast

headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Chris Morris player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: Sabbir will bowl his first over now

commentTextItems.html: poor delivery outside off with room and Rossouw cuts that past point towards the boundary

commentPostTextItems.html: Mashrafe: We could have scored at least 200, maybe 220 then would have been a different game, we kept losing wickets. If someone from opposition gets a hat-trick you go on the back foot. Wicket was pretty good, we can't give that excuse and we need to come back strongly in the next match. Anyone would bat first here, we can't make an excuse after batting and it was a good wicket to bat on. We just didn't bat well.

Amla: Kagiso was outstanding and to restrict them to 160 was wonderful. We've got wonderful players, we are very fortunate. Obviously we miss AB but we have players to rally around. Maybe we gave an extra few runs in the end but we batted pretty well.

Man of the Match Rabada: It's great to just do well for your team and put them in a good position and we won comfortably in the end. I didn't know what to bowl when I was on hat-trick - maybe bouncer, then yorker but I missed it by a mile. It was a bit of a fluke, but I'll take it. It's important to keep the game simple, keep the batsmen guessing and hit good line and length and guess what the batsmen are trying to do. We have one of the best teams in the world and you'd be stupid to not be part of this team, we have a wonderful environment.

All matches done then, SA beat Bangladesh, India beat Zimbabwe, Djokovic beats Gasquet and Federer just beat Murray. Time to switch off then, thanks for joining us and catch us for the second ODI too. Until then, goodbye and good luck!
Sooryanarayanan: "Game, set and match, Roger Federer."

11.15pm A clinical performance from SA here without AB and many of their leading bowlers. But who needs them when you have Kagiso Rabada - debutant with a hat-trick and 6 for 16. Once that skittled Bangladesh out for 16-, SA's batsmen had to make sure they didn't give it away. The pitch was slow, but du Plessis knows how to bat here and was well supported by Rossouw after QDK laid the platform early on. SA go one up with eight-wicket win.
sami: "Can we talk about Football too?" Why not?
Shzad: "It will be first wicket-less ODI for Mustafizur Rahman, Dont know how he will be feeling right now!"

commentTextItems.html: drives the full delivery straight to cover
levels the scores by sweeping that overpitched googly from middle stump to the wide long on boundary for a four. It went high, but was well in the gap to land safe
flights it on middle now with little turn, Faf blocks again
googly turns in from length, Faf unleashes a Test-like block with a forward lean
googly turns away from off, pushed down easily to long off
flighted, juicy, lollipop kind of full toss on leg and Rossouw smashes that to the wide long-on boundary for four
drives the full ball down to mid off now

commentPostTextItems.html: Awais Chakbeli: "Tennis talk should be banned at cricinfo but we can talk about Kohli and Tendulkar sitting together at Centre Court at Wimbledon" Let's not ban things, some things should be left for others

commentTextItems.html: 122kph, fullish cutter outside off, Faf waits and edges it intentionally at the last moment to steer it fine on off for four
touch outside off and RR steers that late to third man for one

commentPreTextItems.html: Anirudh Bishnoi: "The set point for the second set took a longer time than this whole SA chase i guess!" How many deuces was that?

commentTextItems.html: touch short of length on the stumps and RR defends it off the back foot
pushes the length ball from leg back to the bowler

commentPreTextItems.html: 16 more to go in this match

Rasesh: "Federer all the way with a 2 set lead...so...it will be a battle of roga vs joker...alongside...battle of coaches and former winbledon champs...edberg vs becker...mouthwatering contest on cards!"

commentTextItems.html: nudges the length delivery from outside of to backward point for one
steers the ball to leg now and says no for the single, Faf runs back
full delivery just outside of, he reverse sweeps and gets a bottom edge to short third man
well outside off and it's driven against the turn into the covers. That was a googly

commentPreTextItems.html: Fans of both players have replied, it seems

commentTextItems.html: length delivery is turned to the leg side, wide of deep midwicket for two
goes back this time and punches it down to log off
bit of flight on middle and leg, he defends it to off
appeal for lbw as MM angles the ball in, Faf misses and is struck in front of leg, going down leg

commentPostTextItems.html: Anyone knows the score at Wimbledon?

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Nasir Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Sabbir Rahman b Nasir Hossain 35 (41b 5x4 0x6 59m) SR: 85.36

dismissalComment.html: QDK has given a catch to cover! It was pitched up outside off, QDK saw room and drove it in the air, but straight to Sabbir Rahman. Sharp catch as the ball was travelling fast

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Mahmudullah b Mashrafe Mortaza 14 (18b 2x4 0x6 23m) SR: 77.77

dismissalComment.html: the captain gets his counterpart! Amla shuffled across towards off and exposed his stumps, clipped the ball late from off but straight to short fine leg

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis not out 63 (75b 7x4 0x6 116m) SR: 84
Rilee Rossouw not out 45 (53b 5x4 1x6 80m) SR: 84.9

notes: Bangladesh innings
Rain: Bangladesh - 0/0

Bangladesh: 50 runs in 9.5 overs (59 balls), Extras 8
Over 10.1: Review by South Africa (Bowling), Umpire - MA Gough, Batsman - Shakib Al Hasan (Struck down)
5th Wicket: 50 runs in 71 balls (Shakib Al Hasan 27, Mushfiqur Rahim 22, Ex 1)
Drinks: Bangladesh - 93/5 in 19.5 overs (Shakib Al Hasan 33)
Bangladesh: 100 runs in 22.1 overs (133 balls), Extras 10
Over 25.1: Review by Bangladesh (Batting), Umpire - Sharfuddoula, Batsman - Shakib Al Hasan (Struck down)
Bangladesh: 150 runs in 33.6 overs (205 balls), Extras 16

Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 8.0 (Mandatory - 33 runs, 1 wicket)
South Africa: 50 runs in 11.4 overs (70 balls), Extras 4

Drinks: South Africa - 95/2 in 20.0 overs (F du Plessis 29, RR Rossouw 12)
South Africa: 100 runs in 20.4 overs (124 balls), Extras 5

South Africa: 150 runs in 29.5 overs (179 balls), Extras 7

milestones.description: Tamim Iqbal has scored 36 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Shakib's record
Shakib has scored 6 hundreds in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Tamim Iqbal's record

stories.title: Bangladesh v South Africa, 2015
stories.subTitle: 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Bangladesh v South Africa, 2015
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the first ODI, Bangladesh v South Africa, 2015

stories.title: Soumya, Sabbir, Litton look for answers
stories.subTitle: South Africa in Bangladesh 2015
stories.seoTitle: Soumya, Sabbir, Litton look for answers
stories.summary: Having been faced with the first hurdles of their international careers, Bangladesh's most promising young batsmen need to find a quick solution to show their mettle and prove doubters wrong all over again

image.caption: Sabbir Rahman is cleaned up by Stuart Binny
image.longCaption: Sabbir Rahman is cleaned up by Stuart Binny, Bangladesh v India, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, June 24, 2015

stories.title: 'Didn't dream of a start like this' - Rabada
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: 'Didn't dream of a start like this' - Kagiso Rabada
stories.summary: After finishing with the best-ever figures on ODI debut, Kagiso Rabada said he hadn't dreamt of a start like this to his ODI career

image.caption: Kagiso Rabada celebrates his hat-trick with his team-mates
image.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada celebrates his hat-trick with his team-mates, Bangladesh v South Africa, 1st ODI, Mirpur, July 10, 2015

stories.title: Used eight-batsmen strategy to boost confidence - Mashrafe
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Used eight-batsmen strategy to boost confidence - Mashrafe
stories.summary: Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza has said that the side employed an eight-batsmen strategy in the first ODI against South Africa to bolster the sagging confidence of the line-up

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan executes the cut
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan executes the cut, Bangladesh v South Africa, 1st ODI, Mirpur, July 10, 2015

stories.title: Kagiso Rabada: From schoolboy to sporting sensation
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Kagiso Rabada: From schoolboy to sporting sensation
stories.summary: Kagiso Rabada has gone rapidly from 6 for 25 in the Under-19 World Cup semi-final to 9 for 33 in a first-class innings to 6 for 16 on ODI debut. Who knows how much better is to come

image.caption: Kagiso Rabada celebrates after dismissing Mahmudullah
image.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada celebrates after dismissing Mahmudullah, Bangladesh v South Africa, 1st ODI, Mirpur, July 10, 2015

stories.title: Rabada's record six-for sets up South Africa win
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Rabada's record six-for sets up South Africa win
stories.summary: Kagiso Rabada took 6 for 16 - the best figures by any bowler on ODI debut - and became only the second bowler to take a hat-trick on ODI debut as South Africa beat Bangladesh by eight wickets in the first ODI

image.caption: Kagiso Rabada celebrates his hat-trick with his team-mates
image.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada celebrates his hat-trick with his team-mates, Bangladesh v South Africa, 1st ODI, Mirpur, July 10, 2015

stories.title: Mashrafe wary of SA's spin threat
stories.subTitle: South Africa in Bangladesh 2015
stories.seoTitle: Mashrafe wary of SA's spin threat
stories.summary: Bangladesh captain Mashrafe Mortaza has said that he is wary about South Africa's spin threat, and is hoping that his batsmen and spinners can step up to the challenge in the ODIs

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan appeals
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan appeals, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 5th ODI, Mirpur, December 1, 2014

stories.title: Confident ODI sides resume battle of spin
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 1st ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Confident ODI sides resume battle of spin
stories.summary: Bangladesh and South Africa face each other for the first time in ODIs since the 2011 World Cup and Bangladesh are riding high on confidence after series wins against Pakistan and India

image.caption: Kyle Abbott had Tamim Iqbal caught down the leg side for 5
image.longCaption: Kyle Abbott had Tamim Iqbal caught down the leg side for 5, Bangladesh v South Africa, 1st T20 international, Mirpur, July 5, 2015

videos.subTitle: Bangladesh v SA, 1st ODI, Mirpur
videos.seoTitle: 'Didn't dream of a start like this' - Rabada
videos.summary: Kagiso Rabada on his dream debut against Bangladesh in the first ODI in Mirpur, where he finished with a record 6 for 16, including a hat-trick

videos.seoTitle: Moonda: Rabada took responsibility, showed what he can do

videos.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 1st ODI, Mirpur
videos.seoTitle: Quick Facts: Record-breaking ODI debut for Rabada
videos.summary: Kagiso Rabada triggered a Bangladesh collapse finishing with 6 for 16 the best ODI figures by a debutant, which included a hat-trick

videos.subTitle: Bangladesh v South Africa, 1st ODI, Mirpur
videos.seoTitle: Isam: Bangladesh look to secure Champions Trophy 2017 berth
videos.summary: Mohammad Isam reports from Mirpur where Bangladesh need a single win in the ODI series over an AB de Villiers-less South Africa side to ensure a berth in the Champions Trophy
